Package it.uniroma1.mdp.model.card

Class DeckOfCards

java.lang.Object
java.util.Observable
it.uniroma1.mdp.model.card.DeckOfCards
Direct Known Subclasses:
DiscardPile, StockPile
public class DeckOfCards extends Observable
Represents a deck of 52 cards, designed as a poker deck of cards. Extends Observable to notify observers of changes in the deck.

  • Method Details

    • peek

      public Card peek() throws EmptyDeckException
      Allows to look at the top card of this stack without removing it from the collection. Throws an EmptyDeckException if the deck of cards is empty.
      Throws:
      EmptyDeckException

    • pop

      public Card pop() throws EmptyDeckException
      Removes the card at the top of this stack and returns that card. Throws an EmptyDeckException if the deck of cards is empty.
      Throws:
      EmptyDeckException

    • push

      public Card push(Card card) throws FullDeckException, InvalidCardException
      Pushes a card onto the top of this stack. Throws FullDeckException if the deck is full. Throws InvalidCardException if the argument passed is null or already present in the deck.
      Throws:
      FullDeckException
      InvalidCardException

    • search

      public boolean search(Card card) throws InvalidCardException
      Returns true if the Card reference is already present in the deck; false otherwise. Throws InvalidCardException if the passed Card is null.
      Throws:
      InvalidCardException

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string representation of the deck by joining each card's string representation with a newline.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object

    • getCard

      public Card getCard(int index) throws ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException
      Returns the card at the specified position.
      Throws:
      ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException

    • isEmpty

      public boolean isEmpty()
      Tests if this stack is empty.

    • isFull

      public boolean isFull()
      Tests if this stack is full.

    • getSize

      public int getSize()
      Returns the size of the stack.

    • setCard

      public void setCard(int index, Card card) throws ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException
      Set the given card at the specified index. Throws 'ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException' if the index is not valid.
      Throws:
      ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException
